trial_identification.studytitle: Prospective Audit of PICC (Peripheral Inserted Central Catheter) insertion by Nurse led service, comparison with adhoc insertion by Anaesthestists and Trainees.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Patients at the Royal Melbourne Hospital scheduled for Peripherally inserted Central catheters will be recruited to observe the quality of insertion, success and complication rate.

interventions.interventions: Follow-up of all PICC lines placed by the Department of Anaesthesia and Pain management in patients booked on emergency theatre booking system (ETBS). During insertion data will be recorded by an independent observer. Baseline data including age, sex, ASA physical status, previous PICC insertion and indication for PICC will be recorded At 4 weeks patient history will be reviewed for complications and the patient telephoned for satisfaction with PICC line.
interventions.comparator: Previous data from ad-hoc specialists at same institution 2008

primaryOutcome.outcome: Insertion time that is time from skin preparation until application n of the skin dressing, by an independent observer using standardised form.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: this outcome will be assessed by an independent observer during the procedure (medical student).

secondaryOutcome.outcome: complications at the time of insertion - that is failure of insertion, arterial puncture, acute thrombosis, inability to insert catheter, this will be assessed prospectively at the time of procedure using audit data
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: this will be assessed prospectively at the time of procedure

secondaryOutcome.outcome: A 4 week interview via phone call to patient to review patient satisfaction and reason for removal
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: This outcome will be assessed at 4 weeks post insertion of the peripheral inserted central catheter

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: All Patients presenting for PICC insertion at RMH

recruitment.hospital: Royal Melbourne Hospital - City campus - Parkville

ethicsAndSummary.summary: All patients presenting for PICC line insertion will be offered follow-up in this audit of Nurse led PICC insertion at the RMH. Time of insertion, success, complications and patient satisfaction will be measured and this data will be compared to same data subsets acquired from same patient population in 2008, but when the service was physcian led.
